Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of lotus flower in added red and added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of spotted boar (shoulder, crest and part of back with white spots remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU24), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios. The sample number is written in ink 'NAU 24' on break. For parallels regarding the boar, see British Museum 1888,0601.466.d-f.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 573, pl. 73)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-9, p. 82-3, fig. 2) (NAU 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0619) (phase 2)
